results.title: The Domino
results.creator_credit: Robert Stenhouse, Hugh Macdonald and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: An individual is working happily by himself when he is increasingly interrupted by proliferating bureaucracy that eventually totally thwarts his capacity to work. This animated cartoon is an illustration of any activity that loses its originality or purpose when support services and administration become an end in themselves. An entertainment on a universal theme.

results.title: The Doctor
results.brief_description: Members of the medical profession may specialise in one or perhaps more of the hundreds of branches of medical science, according to their own choice and ability. This doctor is a children’s specialist - a pediatrician - and the film is designed to show both parents and children what a typical day’s work is like for him, in a big hospital, and at his private consulting rooms.

results.title: The division of radiophysics
results.brief_description: Describes the current research work being undertaken by the CSIRO division of Radiophysics, including radio astronomy, moon echoes, radar meteorology, radio-controlled models, rain making, electronic computing, radar aids to navigation, aids to airport control, and upper air investigations.

results.title: The Distant lens
results.creator_credit: Glenda Hambly, Owen Paterson, Paul D. Barron and Perth Institute of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Looks at the past of Western Australia, taking the audience through a kaleidoscope of events, including two wars, Royal visits, the Group Settlement, the first aeroplane flights, and the 1920 centenary parades. Composed of photographs and archive film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Glenda Hambly, Owen Paterson, Paul D. Barron and Perth Institute of Film and Television

results.title: The Devil's gateway
results.brief_description: Blood and the Imaginary of blood, both play a prominent part in Christian worship. The most common experience of blood - women’s menstrual bleeding - is still widely regarded as ‘unclean’. Explores the power and impact of the taboo on menstruating women still practised in society and four major religions - Orthodox Christianity, Islam, Hinduism and Orthodox Judaism. The fears women experience and the guilt and shame induced by centuries of suppression masquerading as religious laws are examined. In this program, women from all cultures describe their personal and social consequences of menstruation.

results.title: The Devil
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: Happily married artist is tempted by beautiful model. The Devil delights in making matters worse. Cast includes Arthur V. johnson, George Gebhardt, Harold Salter, Florence Lawrence, Mack Sennett. Silent film with no intertitles.

results.title: The Development of instruments and their music: a symphony is recorded
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Clayre, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Shows the rehearsal and performance of C.P.E. Bach’s Symphony in D by the Croyland Chamber Orchestra, as it was recorded for the Open University gramophone record “The Rise of the Symphony.” Examines the steps taken to achieve a musically authoritative recording of an 18th century orchestral work.

results.title: The Development of communication
results.brief_description: Inventions are a social phenomena, although the influence of one person always tends to make them seem the result of a miraculous individual effort. This film shows the social conditions which gave rise to the invention of the battery, the ground connection, the electro-magnet, the telephone, telegraph, cable, and radio, thus making possible much more rapid and reliable communication services than had been possible in the pre-electric age. These more rapid communications were essential if industrialisation was to develop and expand.

results.title: The Desert fox
results.creator_credit: Stephen Hills, Dennis Tupicoff and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: July, 1942, war veterans recall the best fighting animal of the era, and a great mate - the desert fox (who looks remarkably like Rommel), captured in a visual array of claymation, stop frame and animation in this war mockumentary.
